overview_summary: Neighbors consist of major energy companies (WRB Refining – a Phillips 66/Cenovus joint venture, and Shell Oil), a regional fuel retailer (Midwest Petroleum), and local government bodies (Roxana school and park districts). The industrial neighbors are externally owned and wield significant economic resources, while the school and park districts rely on refinery property taxes and have banded together to protect their revenue (generally supporting growth that bolsters the tax base). None of these entities is a pure land speculator or direct competitor in energy development, but the refinery JV and Shell have the financial means to influence or oppose new projects if their operational interests or liability concerns are threatened.

neighbors.name: Wrb Refining Llc
neighbors.claims: WRB Refining LP (a Phillips 66–Cenovus joint venture) operates the Wood River Refinery in Roxana, Illinois, a 2,200-acre facility processing ~356,500 barrels of oil per day [Portfolio+ — company, retrieved 2025-12-08; "jointly owned by Phillips 66 and Cenovus" ([portfolio-pplus.azurewebsites.net](https://portfolio-pplus.azurewebsites.net/SiteMains/Details/425#:~:text=Located%20in%20Roxana%2C%20Illinois%2C%20and,River%20receives%20Canadian%20and%20domestic))](https://portfolio-pplus.azurewebsites.net/SiteMains/Details/425) [Reuters — news, retrieved 2025-12-08; "total capacity of 356,500 barrels per day" ([www.reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/planned-turnaround-ongoing-phillips-66s-wood-river-refinery-iir-says-2025-03-20/#:~:text=Phillips%2066%27s%20Wood%20River%20refinery%2C,bpd%20vacuum))](https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/planned-turnaround-ongoing-phillips-66s-wood-river-refinery-iir-says-2025-03-20/). In 2012, local taxing bodies (including Roxana CUSD 1 and Roxana Park District) sued to prevent WRB from obtaining property tax exemptions by classifying ~$3 billion in new refinery equipment as pollution control facilities [Illinois Appellate Court — court, retrieved 2025-12-08; "sought the preferential tax treatment of about $3 billion in improvements as pollution control facilities" ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=United%20States%20and%20is%20a,5%20of%20the%20Property))](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html). After years of dispute, a 2024 settlement increased the refinery’s assessed value and commits WRB to pay around $28.7 million per year in local property taxes through 2028 [The Telegraph — news, retrieved 2025-12-08; "Wood River Refinery to pay $28.7 million annually in tax settlement" ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php#:~:text=Wood%20River%20Refinery%20to%20pay,million%20annually%20in%20tax%20settlement))](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php). Phillips 66 (operator of WRB) also invested over $1.1 million in 2024 to support more than 100 local organizations as part of community engagement efforts [EdGlenToday — news, retrieved 2025-12-08; "supported over 100 local organizations ... invested over $1.1 million in total support" ([m.edglentoday.com](https://m.edglentoday.com/articles/details.cfm?id=78952#:~:text=at%20Lewis%20%26%20Clark%20Junior,1%20million%20in%20total%20support)) ([m.edglentoday.com](https://m.edglentoday.com/articles/details.cfm?id=78952#:~:text=66%20Wood%20River%20Refinery%20supported,1%20million%20in%20total%20support))](https://m.edglentoday.com/articles/details.cfm?id=78952).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls largest local industry and tax base; major employer; engages extensively in community funding

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Wood River Refinery leadership (via Phillips 66's public affairs liaison) to address any safety or tax concerns; emphasize mutually beneficial community outcomes to align with the company’s public relations and economic priorities

neighbors.name: Midwest Petroleum Company
neighbors.claims: Midwest Petroleum Company (MPC) is a family-owned fuel retailer and distributor founded in 1946 in St. Louis, Missouri ([midwestpetro.com](https://midwestpetro.com/about.php#:~:text=Midwest%20Petroleum%20Company%2C%20commonly%20referred,Louis)), and was purchased by Don McNutt in 1993 ([midwestpetro.com](https://midwestpetro.com/about.php#:~:text=Midwest%20Petroleum%20Company%2C%20commonly%20referred,Louis)). MPC supplies gasoline wholesale and operates convenience store gas stations in the St. Louis/Madison County region ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/603/1099/1888566/#:~:text=Louis%2C%20Missouri,having%20their%20principal%20places%20of)). In 2023, Midwest Petroleum opened a new gas station in Wood River, IL, which local officials praised as a welcome boost to economic development ([www.edglentoday.com](https://www.edglentoday.com/articles/details/midwest-petroleum-gas-station-opens-in-wood-river-67641.cfm#:~:text=great%20idea,River%20officials%20were%20present%20as)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Operates a single local gas station; not a major landholder or employer in the area

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage owner Don McNutt directly to ensure the project does not disrupt their gas station operations; emphasize benefits like increased local traffic and coordinate on any construction impacts to maintain good relations

neighbors.name: Roxana Community Unit School Dist 1
neighbors.claims: Roxana Community Unit School District No. 1 (CUSD 1) is a public school district whose budget heavily depends on property taxes from the Wood River Refinery, its single largest taxpayer ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=Roxana%20Community%20Park%20District%3B%20South,of%20about%20%243%20billion%20in)). The district took an active role in opposing any loss of tax revenue: in 2012, Roxana CUSD 1 joined other local bodies in suing to block WRB Refining’s attempt to exempt roughly $3 billion in refinery improvements from taxation via pollution-control status ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=United%20States%20and%20is%20a,5%20of%20the%20Property)). After protracted disputes, a mediated 2024 agreement now guarantees the refinery will pay about $28.7 million annually to the school district and others through 2028 ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php#:~:text=Wood%20River%20Refinery%20to%20pay,million%20annually%20in%20tax%20settlement)) ([www.thetelegraph.com](https://www.thetelegraph.com/news/article/madison-county-school-district-wood-river-refinery-19822271.php#:~:text=average%20of%20nearly%20%2428,each%20year)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Key local institution with public support; successfully rallied other agencies to protect its tax base

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Superintendent Debra Kreutztrager and the school board to address any concerns about tax revenue or student safety; consider offering educational programs or revenue-sharing to demonstrate the project’s benefits to the district

neighbors.name: Shell Oil Company
neighbors.claims: Shell Oil Company owned and operated the Wood River Refinery for decades (it founded the facility in 1918 via its Roxana Petroleum subsidiary) and remains involved in the village only to manage legacy pollution from its former operations ([www.offshore-technology.com](https://www.offshore-technology.com/projects/wrbwoodriverfacility/#:~:text=Built%20in%201918%20by%20Shell%2C,July%202007%2C%20operates%20the%20refinery)) ([royaldutchshellplc.com](https://royaldutchshellplc.com/2011/06/09/roxana-residents-assail-shell-over-benzene-worries/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=The%20benzene%20leak%20has%20been,of%20two%201986%20benzene%20leaks)). The Village of Roxana and residents have sued Shell over benzene contamination; a 2012 lawsuit alleged Shell’s refinery activities left benzene levels 26,000 times above the legal limit in local groundwater ([royaldutchshellgroup.com](https://royaldutchshellgroup.com/2012/03/29/village-claims-shell-oil-ruined-its-water/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=Roxana%2C%20a%20village%20of%201%2C550,than%20allowed%20by%20state%20law)) ([royaldutchshellgroup.com](https://royaldutchshellgroup.com/2012/03/29/village-claims-shell-oil-ruined-its-water/?nb=1&share=print#:~:text=match%20at%20L21%20The%20Village,affiliates%2C%20in%20Madison%20County%20Court)). Shell has fought to limit its liability — in 2019 the Seventh Circuit Court of Appeals dismissed a class-action by Roxana property owners seeking damages for the pollution, a decision favoring Shell’s position ([www.courthousenews.com](https://www.courthousenews.com/shell-let-off-the-hook-on-benzene-pollution/#:~:text=CHICAGO%20%28CN%29%20,sue%20Shell%20Oil%20for%20pollution)) ([www.courthousenews.com](https://www.courthousenews.com/shell-let-off-the-hook-on-benzene-pollution/#:~:text=Circuit%20refused%20to%20let%20Roxana%2C,sue%20Shell%20Oil%20for%20pollution)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No active local operations or employment; primarily known for past pollution issues and legal defenses rather than community engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Shell’s environmental remediation team if the project site overlaps any contaminated areas; otherwise, ensure compliance with regulatory standards to avoid provoking corporate objections

neighbors.name: Roxana Community Park District
neighbors.claims: Roxana Community Park District is a local government unit that provides parks and recreation, funded principally by local property taxes and user fees ([roxanapark.org](https://roxanapark.org/mission/#:~:text=Mission%20,user%20fees%2C%20within%20financial%20limits)). The Park District joined Roxana CUSD 1, the Village of Roxana, and others in a 2012 lawsuit opposing WRB Refining’s bid to classify about $3 billion of refinery improvements as tax-exempt pollution control facilities (which would have reduced the district’s tax revenue) ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=HARTFORD%20SCHOOL%20,)) ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/illinois/court-of-appeals-fourth-appellate-district/2012/4-12-0331.html#:~:text=taxpayer,5%20of%20the%20Property)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small taxing body with limited resources; relies on alliances with larger entities to exert influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with Park District officials to explain that the project will not encroach on park land or reduce their funding; offer support for community recreation initiatives to build goodwill
